intro: Plukenetia conophora, commonly known as the African butternut, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, orange-colored fruit that contains a single seed. It is often cultivated for its edible seeds, which are rich in oil and used in local cuisines. Additionally, the plant has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
